metadata.Title: CVE-2014-2892 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the get_answer function in mmsh.c in libmmsbefore 0.6.4 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a longline in an MMS over HTTP (MMSH) server response.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-2892` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmms0 - 0.6.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libmms package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.6.4-1').
